com.complexible.stardog.api.reasoning
Interface ReasoningConnection

All Superinterfaces:
com.complexible.common.base.Closeable, Connection
public interface ReasoningConnection
extends Connection

SNARL Connection which exposes reasoning specific functionality such as explanations and consistency checking.

Since:
0.7.3
Version:
2.0
Author:
Michael Grove, Hector Perez-Urbina

Method Detail

isConsistent

boolean isConsistent()
                     throws StardogException
Checks the consistency of the database with the current reasoning level. If the consistency check has been performed before and the database has not changed this function will return the previously computed result immediately. Besides this caching functionality, this function always returns the same result as the isConsistent(ContextSets.ALL) call.

Returns:
true if the database is consistent, false otherwise
Throws:
StardogException

isConsistent

boolean isConsistent(Collection<URI> theActiveGraphs)
                     throws StardogException
Checks the consistency of the specified named graphs with the current reasoning level. The consistency results for arbitrary set of named graphs are not cached so this function will perform a new consistency check over at each invocation.

Returns:
true if the database is consistent, false otherwise
Throws:
StardogException

isSatisfiable

boolean isSatisfiable(URI theClass)
                      throws StardogException
Checks whether the class is satisfiable with respect to the current KB and reasoning level

Parameters:
theClass - the class
Returns:
true if the class is satisfiable, false otherwise
Throws:
StardogException
